For any of you with doubts, cast them aside. This works perfectly. The only thing you will need to edit is the Skidrow.ini in your B2 > Binaries > Win32 directory. And the only thing to change there is the name it uses. And that probably does not matter if you are only playing single player and have no existing saves when you install. (Remember to put your name in quotes like the language is.)

I too hate when things are made into a executable. I greatly prefer simple archives and manual installation. But it is this way so even morons can figure it out. (Fuck those morons. They can either pull their heads from their asses or buy the game and the DLC.)

Nonetheless, I thank you for this nosTEAM.

@qrty5
The easiest way by far is to install the game *WITHOUT* any patches, start any character with the original keys set to 255 and get to the first save location you can after pressing i to pull up your inventory at least once to see the message confirming your keys.

Then just close the game, apply this patch and start your new character with 255 keys.

If you want more than 255, then I will quote Hammerlock: "You are sad and I have no desire to speak to you."

I may even call you a Bonerfart.

Alright, I tried the Skidrow version of the same patch. It works equally well. In fact there is no noticeable difference for myself. 

My advice is that if you are already using this, wait until the Skidrow version is needed for something before you bother to download it.

The only noticeable change is the memory ranges are different. So if you made a list of memory locations for money and Eridium and such, you will have to remake the list after patching to the Skidrow release.

And yes, any corrupt messages are because you did not backup your WillowDLC.ini before you cheated. It flags *EVERYTHING* as corrupt when you mess with that after the very first patch.

Backup the file before you edit it. Then when it is time to apply a patch and crack, you can restore it and you will not lose anything. (I.E. if you edited it to give you 255 Golden Keys and then changed it right back to the default it would not take any of those keys away from you.)

golden key glitch works for my version;

go;
C:Program FilesBorderlands 2DLCPOPremierClubLic

Open with notepad (WillowDLC)
Change values;


[GoldenKeys]
+SourceId=254 =change to 508 
+NumKeys=1 =change to 2

[PromotionalUnlocks]
+UnlockId=2

When you restart you will have a G-key, to get another just change it back.
